column4: every time i start a gtk app from terminal, i get this error... Gtk-WARNING **: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "aurora", --anyone know how to fix that?
To see if the error replicates?  I like the theme I'm using...

sounds like the theme wants a particular engine, I see it at http://www.gnome-look.org/content/show.php/Aurora+Gtk+Engine?content=56438 . It's not in ubuntu and I'm not familiar with it. You could compile it ...
Yeah, I've got that -- compiled it, which is how it got on my system...
so it seems to be saying it can't find it
where did you install it to?
I don't have kde installed, but locate kio-whatever , then dpkg -S /path/to/whatever will tell you the package
I wanted to get rid of the package, but it was required for amarok, which I cannot live without :)
heh. Kde is what it is, I guess
Yeah, KDE is crap IMO but there's a couple of K apps that are definitely nice.
or you both can join #onyx , it's faster than registration
if you used the ones from their sites, yes
Cool, thanks :) -- just caught me off guard for a sec.
I'm using the ones from the nvidia site because I've got a custom kernel, so I figured that had something to do with it
I've got to do that myself for the new kernel upgrade, but I decided to wait a couple weeks with the xorg fiasco
Ahh, it wasn't too bad with xorg -- it just kept repeatedly crashing... i just had to stop gdm, wget the drivers, and install them again.
yeah, I helped someone do that last night. I'm lazy, so I'll just procrastinate a little more :)
